relation: There are always safety officers walking around the campus. Also the police are usually apparent throughout the course of buildings. It makes for a safe environment and a sense of security.
There are all kinds of clubs you can join at JCTC.

At JCTC if you are interested in the arts. The art program holds many new things to enjoy throughout the year. They set up galleries and even have different events you can participate in and get discounts as a JCTC student. There are also Phi Theta Kappa which is highly involved with the community and is filled with great students and advisors.

For new students interested in JCTC it is a great way to enter into the college life. As JCTC is filled with all kinds of people you'll learn many new things about your career path and the kind of people you may encounter in your career. It's a great environment to work through and you'll enjoy the teachers and staff you come in contact with.

JCTC is a fun active college ready to take on new things. It is filled with helping teachers and advisors to guide you through you college career. JCTC is great for a new student or a returning student as they help you start or finish your college career.

At least in the program I attend works out well for the degree I will earn. $2000 a semester, 149485=JCTC is a great community college because they have small classrooms and awesome teachers. textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Allison from New Castle, KY 10/13/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 50 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Jefferson Community and Technical College has a wide range of students and is great for anyone. Different personalities and interests will not effect the relationships that you develop on campus, nor the things that you learn. Tips for prospective students Do not be afraid to speak to those around you. Jefferson is not similar to other schools in that you do not have all of these traditional students around judging you for the person that you are. Friends can be found in a variety of walks of life if only you open up a little. Also, do not be afraid to talk to your professors about problems that you are having. Most of them have taught at other schools and are at Jefferson for the friendly, community feel. They really are there to help you, not just as the cliche
